snippet: Leaders of the Working Families Party say Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has drifted too far to the right, and are privately talking about nominating their own candidate to run for governor this year.
abstract: New York State's Working Families Party is debating whether to re-endorse Gov Andrew M Cuomo, expressing concern that his policies have drifted too far to the right as he courts Republican constituencies; party, one of state's most effective political organizations, is also discussing whether to field their own candidate; split has prompted Cuomo to attempt to mend fences with liberal wing of his party.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and SUSANNE CRAIG

lead_paragraph: Leaders of the Working Families Party say Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has drifted too far to the right, and are privately talking about nominating their own candidate to run for governor this year.

headline.main: Cuomo Works to Mend Fences With Liberals
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Works to Mend Fences With Liberals
